title: Slash's over-the-top rock-star playground, 'too much' for family, is listed at $11M
text:

Rock star Slash, formerly of Guns N' Roses, and Perla Hudson are divorcing and have put their Tuscan-style home in the Beverly Hills gated community of Mulholland Estates … more on the market for $10,995,000. She describes the style she decorated it in as "rock-star chic." Its touches include skull and pirate motifs, a basement nightclub and a practically obligatory mirrored bedroom ceiling. Click here to read more about it on Yahoo Homes. less By Sid Lipsey 
When Guns N' Roses were singing about "Paradise City" back in 1987, they could have had in mind guitarist Slash's future house — a paradise for fans of (partially) family-friendly rock-and-roll excess, complete with skull and pirate motifs, crystal ship chandeliers and a basement nightclub. 
Slash — whose real name is Saul Hudson — has listed the Tuscan-style estate he shared with his wife, Perla Hudson, and their two sons for almost $11 million. The couple filed for divorce last year. Slash's family joins him to celebrate his star on the Hollywood Walk of Fame in 2012. … 
"It's just too much house for me and two boys," Perla Hudson, who designed the home herself, tells Yahoo Homes. "We're downsizing." 
The 7-bedroom, 8-bath mansion in Beverly Hills' Mulholland Estates neighborhood has a gigantic playroom upstairs and a 36-foot skate ramp in the backyard. 
But don't forget, Slash lived here too. 
"The parties we've had here ... " says Perla Hudson, who calls the home's decorative scheme "rock-star chic." Slash and Perla literally partied like rock stars here, primarily in the home's most baller feature: a full-scale nightclub with DJ booth and full bar. 
"We can easily get 100 people in here," Hudson says of the glitzy basement club, revealing that the space has seen some R-rated (and naughtier) antics. It was here they threw their legendary New Year's Eve parties; Black Eyed Peas singer Fergie famously attended the 2014 bash. 
The downstairs club even comes with its very own stripper pole. "I have a portable one I'll be taking with me," Hudson says, laughing. 
The listing is held by Jade Mills of Coldwell Banker Previews International.
